main event: A round white light was observed in Columbia, South Carolina on November 12, 1957, followed by a report of an oval shaped object seen on November 15, 1957.
interesting points: The first sighting involved a round white light the size of a dime with a trail three times its diameter that had an orange tinge., The object disappeared suddenly without fading., The second sighting involved an oval shaped object about the size of a nickel that moved erratically., The report for the first sighting was received six hours after observation with no clear explanation given., The second sighting was concluded to possibly be Venus despite the uncertain nature of the object.
sighted object: one round white light (first sighting) and one oval shaped object (second sighting)
witness description: A civilian appraising the sky while at Fort Jackson.
